com.myscript.atk.itc

Class StrokeFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.myscript.atk.itc.StrokeFactory

  • public class StrokeFactory
extends Object
    Factory in charge of creating SmartStroke objects

      • createSubStroke

        public SmartStroke createSubStroke(SmartStroke stroke,
                          int begin,
                          int end,
                          int strokeType)
        Creates a sub SmartStroke from the given stroke. This way of creating a stroke is mainly used
        when gestures occur but could also be used in case of copy(cut)/paste feature.
        Parameters:
        stroke - The original stroke to copy
        begin - The index of start to create the new stroke from the old one
        end - The index of end to create the new stroke
        strokeType - The type of the stroke that will be created
        Returns:
        The stroke created

      • createCopyOfStroke

        public SmartStroke createCopyOfStroke(SmartStroke stroke,
                             int strokeType)
        Creates a copy of the given stroke. Be careful to choose the right stroke type depending on
        whether this stroke shall be recognized or not once added to a page
        The copied stroke will have its timestamp shifted to the time this method is
        called
        Parameters:
        stroke - The original stroke to copy
        strokeType - The type of the stroke that will be created
        Returns:
        The copied stroke

      • createMovedStroke

        public SmartStroke createMovedStroke(SmartStroke stroke,
                            float dx,
                            float dy,
                            int strokeType)
        Creates a stroke with the given translation values to add it to the page. Be careful to choose the right StrokeType to launch recognition.
        Parameters:
        dx - Amount in the X direction to offset the stroke.
        dy - Amount in the Y direction to offset the stroke.
        strokeType - Type of the stroke to be created.
        Returns:
        Stroke moved.

      • createScaledStroke

        public SmartStroke createScaledStroke(SmartStroke stroke,
                             float scaleX,
                             float scaleY,
                             int strokeType)
        Creates a SmartStroke with the given scale values to add it to the page. Be careful to choose the right SmartStroke to launch recognition.


        Parameters:
        strokeType - Type of the stroke to be created.
        Returns:
        Stroke scaled.

      • createTransformedStroke

        public SmartStroke createTransformedStroke(SmartStroke stroke,
                                  Transform transform,
                                  int strokeType)
        Creates a SmartStroke with the given transformed values to add it to the page. Be careful to choose the right SmartStroke to launch recognition.


        Parameters:
        strokeType - Type of the stroke to be created.
        Returns:
        Stroke transformed.

      • createStrokeFromByteArray

        public SmartStroke createStrokeFromByteArray(byte[] strokeBytes)
        Creates a SmartStroke from the given byte array coming from a previous serialization.


        See SmartStroke.toByteArray() for serialization.

        Parameters:
        strokeBytes - The byte array to create the IStroke with.
        Returns:
        Stroke created from the given byte array.
